title: How to Make a Fruit Cake (with Chocolate Biscuits)

steps.headline: Find a glass bowl.
steps.description: Rub a little layer of melted butter around the sides and across the base. This helps stop the cake from sticking to the base and sides.

steps.headline: Crush some chocolate biscuits.
steps.description: Make a layer of crushed biscuits inside the bowl. To crush the biscuits, place them inside a resealable bag and roll a rolling pin over the top. Simply tip the crumbs out of the bag and into the bowl.

steps.headline: Chop the fresh fruits into small pieces.
steps.description: You can use one kind of fruit, or a variety of mixed fruits. Use the chopped fruits to make another layer on the top of the biscuit layer.

steps.headline: Pour fresh cream into another bowl.
steps.description: Add a little bit of melted butter and strawberry or red colour.

steps.headline: Whip the cream for at least 5 minutes, until firm.
Spoon the whipped cream on the layers of cake.
Add one more layer of crushed biscuits.
steps.description: Firm down with the back of a large spoon.

steps.headline: Place the cake in the fridge.
Serve.
steps.description: Once chilled, your cake is ready to eat. Cut into slices and enjoy.

text: Find a glass bowl. Rub a little layer of melted butter around the sides and across the base. This helps stop the cake from sticking to the base and sides. Crush some chocolate biscuits. Make a layer of crushed biscuits inside the bowl. To crush the biscuits, place them inside a resealable bag and roll a rolling pin over the top. Simply tip the crumbs out of the bag and into the bowl. Chop the fresh fruits into small pieces. You can use one kind of fruit, or a variety of mixed fruits. Use the chopped fruits to make another layer on the top of the biscuit layer. Pour fresh cream into another bowl. Add a little bit of melted butter and strawberry or red colour. Whip the cream for at least 5 minutes, until firm.  Spoon the whipped cream on the layers of cake.  Add one more layer of crushed biscuits. Firm down with the back of a large spoon. Place the cake in the fridge. Refrigerate it for 20 minutes. Serve. Once chilled, your cake is ready to eat. Cut into slices and enjoy.
